resources.string: This is a server application for the Lowest Unique N Game. Your phone will host the game and other devices will be able to connect to your IP address and play using their web browsers.\nMake sure to check the network setup before playing!
For LAN play, make sure that the network allows devices to see each other on the selected port. For internet play, you will need to have a public IPv4 address and/or port forwarding set up.
Select which number to start counting from. Suggested 1 (natural numbers) or 0 (non-negative integers).
Show for example ">99" for high guesses. Reduces players\' willingness to spam with high or "inappropriate" numbers. Set 0 for no limit.
The game can get addictive. Set a number of rounds to get a reminder to end the game, which can be bypassed. Set 0 for no limit.
Can be paused. Set 0 for no limit.
Note that most Android hotspots are limited to 10 clients. Use an existing Wi-Fi network to increase the limit for LAN games.
Require each player to supply a unique name or other personal ID string while joining. Prevents players from playing on multiple accounts (using browser tabs) under different nicknames.
Select which names pass an automated check before the player can connect to the server.
Any unique name/ID a player provides will be accepted.
Only names/IDs that match a preset regular expression will be accepted. For example, if each student has an ID in the format "st#####", you can require IDs to match "st\d{5}".
Only names/IDs from a preset list will be accepted. This is the most secure option. To minimize hassle, you can use the player list from a previous game.
Choose whether to show a notification for every player connecting to decide whether to accept them.\nYou will still be able to kick out joined players if checks are disabled.
Choose how each player appears to others.
You\'ve been invited to play the Lowest Unique N Game!
To play, connect to %1$s, then scan the QR code or go to
To play, scan the QR code or go to
